column1: Suresnes (French pronunciation: ​[syʁɛn]) is a commune in the western suburbs of Paris
column3: 9.3 km (5.8 mi) from the centre of Paris
column5: 145 as of 2016. The nearest communes are Nanterre
column8: Saint-Cloud and Boulogne-Billancourt. It is served by two stops on Île-de-France tramway Line 2 and Suresnes–Mont-Valérien station on the Transilien network
column9: both giving access to La Défense and its RER A and Paris Métro Line 1 services. The town's landmarks include the Mémorial de la France combattante and Suresnes American Cemetery and Memorial below Fort Mont-Valérien
column10: as well as Foch Hospital in the centre.

column1: Fort Mont-Valérien (Mémorial de la France Combattante) is situated in the commune
column2: as is Suresnes American Cemetery and Memorial. Suresnes has a beautiful view of Paris and the Eiffel Tower.

column1: In 1974 the Spanish Socialist Workers Party held its 26th Congress in Suresnes (it was illegal in Spain under Franco). Felipe González was elected Secretary General
column2: replacing Rodolfo Llopis Ferrándiz. González was from the "reform" wing of the party
column3: and his victory signaled a defeat for the historic and veteran wing of the Party. The direction of the party shifted from the exiles to the young people in Spain who had not fought in the Spanish Civil War.

column1: Suresnes is served by Suresnes–Mont-Valérien station on the Transilien La Défense and Transilien Paris – Saint-Lazare suburban rail lines. It is also served by Île-de-France tramway Line 2
column2: which stops twice in the commune

column1: The Pont de Suresnes carries the Allée de Longchamp
column2: one of the main traffic arteries
column3: from the Bois de Boulogne over the Seine into the western suburbs of Paris.

column1: See: Category:People from SuresnesThe following people have been associated with Suresnes:

column3: partner of former President François Hollande

column1: Noor Inayat Khan (1914–1944) lived in Suresnes with her family in a large estate known as Fazal Manzil from 1920 to 1940 during which time she studied at the Sorbonne. Noor Inayat Khan later returned to France as an agent of the Special Operations Executive
column2: spying for the Allied cause in occupied France. She was executed by the Germans and posthumously awarded the Croix de Guerre and George Cross.
French television presenter and real estate agent

column1: Technician degrees are available at the Lycée Paul-Langevin. Suresnes also hosts the headquarters of the Institut national supérieur de formation et de recherche pour l'éducation des jeunes handicapés et les enseignements adaptés (INS HEA)
column2: a public college in the fields of disability.
